properties.media:imagetext:
Confidenticl
Letter Nox 197-37
September 17, 1937
Mr. H. M. Bixby
Vice President for China
Pan American Airways Co.
Manila, Philippine Islande
Dear Mr. Bixby:
I enclose for your information and files copy of a memo-
randum dated September 8th which I have prepared here and which is
self-explanatory.
The memorandum attached thereto and dated August
25th is, as you will innediately perceive, a synthetic composition of
your menorendum of August 25th and your personal and confidential let-
ter of the same date, but with certain confidential, off-the-record,
and immaterial metter ommitted.
My object was to have one memorandum
giving the record of the events loading up to your departure from China
which would be in such form that it could be show to any interested
parties and form,
if necessary,
a part of a jublished
or legal record.
I believe
this memorandum will fill the purpose I have in mind but if
you have any comments to make, and particularly if you have any addi-
tions to incorporate,
I would appreciate having them in the form of a
supplementary menorandum with no confidential material included which
could be attached to this as a part of the official record.
The mail was
just received today with your letters B-1 to
B-11, omnitting B-2 and B-6 not received, and gives us more information
and a good deal of interesting comment but nothing which I think has to
The President has instructed me,
with the
Comptroller,
prepare a statement showing as pearly as possible the
actual
Losses
to
fered through our forced withdrawl from China.
I find
our
last CNAC
statement is that for May and I do not suppose that a later
statement
will be received.
If you have or can obtain any data tending to
reflect
the balance sheet for CNAC at a later date than
that, we should like to
have
it.
With regard to our PAA losses,
we are having Mr.
Nowlin prepare
a statement of all
property in China
fully owned by Pan American Airways
Company and which we were forced to abandon.
If at a later date any of
this property can be salvaged it can, of course,
be
checked off
on this
list.
I do not know in what manner we will
present our claim for our
fair participation in the assets of CNAC at the time of our withdrawal,
or for losses suffered by PAA (Shanghai).
Vie shall probably consult with
OSSI
